tool.name: CreateElevationTilePackage

param.name: InputElevationSource
param.dialogReference: The elevation source to be used to generate the tiling scheme.

param.name: MCSL
param.dialogReference:
The minimum scale level at which you want to create tiles.

Level 0: Globe | Level 1: Globe | Level 2: Globe | Level 3: Globe | Level 4: Continent | Level 5: Countries | Level 6: Country | Level 7: States | Level 8: Counties | Level 9: Counties | Level 10: County | Level 11: Metropolitan Area | Level 12: Cities | Level 13: City | Level 14: Town | Level 15: Neighborhood | Level 16: City Blocks | Level 17: City Block | Level 18: Buildings | Level 19: Building

Depending on the extent of your elevation source, select the appropriate minimum scale level. The maximum scale level is set to 19.

param.name: PixelTolerance
param.dialogReference: Set the maximum tolerance in pixel values when compressing with LERC. Range is between 0 and 1. Set to 0.1 or less for highly detailed terrain. Set to 0.5 or higher for less detail.

tool.summary:
This tools creates an Elevation Tile Package (*.tpk) from your elevation datasource. The tpk can then be shared to your ArcGIS Online or Portal account for publishing.

Note: this tool only creates a tile package in the ArcGIS Online / Bing Maps / Google Maps Tiling Scheme. If your basemaps are using another tiling scheme, you must create your own tpk. See the ArcGIS Pro online documentation for help on how to do this.
